channel.title: engineering on Data Scientist Hiroki's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in engineering on Data Scientist Hiroki's Blog

item.title: chatGPT vs Gemini: A Comparison from a Physical Model Perspective
item.description: Which Performs Better: chatGPT’s Successor Gemini? I asked both, “Which has higher performance, chatGPT or Gemini?” As of April 2023, chatGPT doesn’t recognize the term “Gemini.” According to Gemini, however, ChatGPT Strengths: Fact-based accuracy Ethical considerations Computational efficiency Weaknesses: Creative writing Humorous writing Multilingual support Gemini Strengths: Creative writing Humorous writing Multilingual support Weaknesses: Fact-based accuracy Ethical issue Computational cost As previously introduced in this blog, we wondered how the March 2024 versions of chatGPT 4 and Gemini Advanced would handle solving a physical model’s Matlab code.

item.title: The Mystery of Matlab's tf2ss
item.description: I love Matlab. Because it’s simple, with just the bare minimum of programming language acquisition, you can do big things easily. And yet, it’s structured and systematic. “You are beautiful” Hello, I’m Hirokiüê∂, a data scientist. The Mystery of the State Space Representation tf2ss from Transfer Functions as introduced in the previous blog, the handy function “tf2ss” that calculates the coefficients (A,B,C,D) of the state space representation from a transfer function is very convenient.

item.title: The Relationship Between Transfer Functions and State Space Representations
item.description: Living can sometimes feel quite difficult. There are so many things that need to be done, and amidst the pressure, it’s easy to rush, make mistakes, and end up having to redo everything. “Especially when busy, don’t rush. It’s okay to do things quickly, but don’t do them in haste.” Let’s take a moment to breathe, have a cup of tea, and proceed calmly. Hello, I’m Hirokiüê∂, a data scientist.

item.title: State-Space Representation of Single-Degree-of-Freedom Vibration Equation(II)
item.description: Hello, I’m Hirokiüê∂, a data scientist. In my previous blog, I introduced the Matlab code to solve the single degree of freedom vibration motion equation. I have modified it a bit more to represent it in terms of inputs and outputs, and I’d like to solve it this way. First, this single degree of freedom vibration model. Normally, it can be written as a motion equation like this: $$\begin{align*} m\ddot{x}+c\dot{x}+kx&=f \

item.title: State-Space Representation of Single-Degree-of-Freedom Vibration Equation
item.description: Single-Degree-of-Freedom Vibration Equation Hello, I’m Hiroki üê∂, a data scientist. In my previous blog I introduced the Matlab code for the physical model, which actually uses a very fancy method called state-space representation. Today, I want to delve a little deeper into this state-space representation. So, in this post, I will introduce: What is state-space representation? The benefits of representing a single-degree-of-freedom vibration model in state-space representation Firstly, this is the single-degree-of-freedom vibration model.

item.title: ChatGPT x Programming of Physical Model
item.description: Programming Physical Modeling with ChatGPT A must-see for a student in science! Expand your learning horizons with this super convenient way to use ChatGPT! Hello, I’m Hiroki üê∂, a data scientist. There’s been a lot of buzz recently about ChatGPT gaining new capabilities! For example, check out this YouTube video. I couldn’t wait to apply this! For instance, a fundamental model taught in the first year of engineering studies is the single-degree-of-freedom vibration model.
